result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryant Dennis Travis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryant Dennis Travis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions -Domestic Violence Court, signed and filed.

Defendant Bryant Dennis Travis in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent: Christine Riggs appears in court.   Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case in court for a probation review hearing. Statements made by probation agent and Defense counsel. 
Court ordered defendant to serve 2 Days of Condition Time. REPORT DAY  July 29, 2016 by 7:00pm.

Sentence Referral form, received and filed.
Probation Status Review, received and filed.

Sentencing proceeded as to count  TWO:  

Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for  zero days  time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for TWO YEARS with the following conditions:
*AODA/ANY TREATMENT DEEMED APPROPRIATE
*25 DAYS CONDITION TIME STAYED UNTIL 7-25-16 AT 1:30 IN BRANCH 47 FOR REVIEW
*PAY MUNICIPAL TICKET CASE 15043916 
*INSTALL IID 
*NO NEW OWI VIOLATIONS

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Bryant Dennis Travis in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNT BOTH COUNTS: 

  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT ONE : 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 DAYS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 5  days time served. NO   Huber privileges.  Court objects to ES. 

Fine of $200.00 including all mandatory  costs, fees and dna surcharges to be paid from bail on deposit. Due to low income.  Review hearing scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bryant Dennis Travis in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense motion to adjourn is granted.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bryant Dennis Travis in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bryant Dennis Travis in court.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is eligible for public defender.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bryant Dennis Travis in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Pre-trial conference.  Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Colloquy held with the defendant.  Defendant willing to assign bail on deposit ($200.00) towards legal fees.  At the direction of the court this clerk telephoned Attorney Jason Canfield.  Attorney Canfield willing to appear to discuss retainer agreement with the defendant on the next date.  Case set for status of counsel before Branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Defendant not to be in possession of any illegal drugs without a valid prescription.
Court ordered the balance of bail ($600.00) to be returned to the remitter.

Defendant Bryant Dennis Travis in court.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 9/8/15 @ 1:30 pm

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08/27/2015

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08/21/2015
